title: Time for me to uninstall
body: I don't know what to say

replies.body: http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/epicrapbattlesofhistory/images/6/62/Wut3.gif/revision/latest?cb=20130901012506
I have like 5, don't worry

i think i remember losing to beginner bots when i was first starting the game a couple years ago, and i remember going into intermediate bots with the original {{champion:15}} after feeling confident enough in my abilities, and being told to uninstall/kill myself/etc because i was a new player and couldn't play very well, causing my teams to lose a lot. i also remember playing {{champion:83}} first time he was free week (i had barely joined the game not even a week before that) and being told the same things as the intermediate bot games i played as {{champion:15}} a couple weeks later simply because i was a new player and barely even knew the basics of the game. _this community is just **soooo** hospitable toward new players isn't it?_ i'm honestly surprised we still get them, especially with the stories from new players you'll see sometimes in the forums....
It's hilarious(ly sad) that people rage in bot games of all things.
They should just carry the game. It really isn't that hard.

Although nothing excuses flaming another player, it should be said co-op breeds passive aggressive behavior. You only have three lanes, but five players. Since there's no real need for jungle or support, eighty percent of the team ends up having to contest each other for their gold income. This quickly escalates into players aggressively pinging you out of their lane, blaming their teammates for "stealing their kills" and the list goes on.

The problem is that co-op is so inherently easy on any difficulty that it doesn't inspire any teamwork and your allies become your only real competition. This has always been the nature of trivial content, when there's no challenge players tend to make min-maxing the goal instead which your allies only get in the way of. For instance, Doom Bots never saw this kind of problem because the game mode was difficult enough that there was an actual real possibility of losing.

Riot always low prioritizes everything but 5v5 SR. The truth is Co-op could use a lot more work as well, the jungle is obviously a huge element to the map and yet bots in co-op pretend it doesn't exist. It doesn't teach new players the importance of warding or jungle pressure and it doesn't motivate players to play the game the way it was intended.
it happens a lot more then you think

No he wasn't.

http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Free_champion_rotation

He's been on rotation three times as noted above : October 2011, April 2012 and November 2012.

there was indeed a time where Yorick was available in the free week rotation. this was like the week after he came out, so of course he was on the free rotation. it was one of the only times where they actually decided to put him in it.

Edit: if you're curious, he has been on the free week rotation only 3 times since his release lol

you know, they actually put {{champion:83}} on sale for **reduced IP **once, you know, to get more people to try him.
First champion I ever bought... I haven't used the guy in a while... it makes me sad.

There was a time when that wouldn't be too surprising. It was a time when the bots were actually pretty tough if you we're playing with a team who just started. Those days the only way to win a 4v5 in bots was to wait in a bush and farm the lane the AI was pushing so they couldn't take the tower. 
After about half an hour you and your 3 allies would get fed enough that you could take out all the bots and rush the nexus. Those were dark days indeed >_<
I still remember the "I survived Annie bot" T-shirt designs.
Now they're back, but for a different reason.
Dayumn.

Well, it happens

Even Alliance and Counter Logic lost matches against bots
Considering 209 bot games is barely enough to reach level 20 IF even that. A loss isn't that surprising.
i remember the old days where the bots were so strong for me

No biggie! 

I lost a bot match one time because we had a bot on our team that was programmed to be an idiot. Would randomly follow a player around and basic attack anything in range, but prioritized following the player it latched on to. It'd use spells and such on the enemy champions, but would randomly go all out without warning and without reason. Essentially it was dumber than the bots we were fighting, and ended up feeding so hard we couldn't win.

And it had to be an Annie.

This is literally every AI game I tried to play. Had to give up after a 55 minute bot game we almost lost and stick to normals for leveling up. Like, every bot game either has a Soraka bot or a Ryze bot or a Yasuo bot.
As far as I'm aware of there is no yasuo bot.

One of my favorite games of league was an intermediate bot game where two of us "humans" were stupid player bots. They fed the bots immensely and the three actual humans on the team had to do some pretty crazy stuff to win. At one point I had to 1v5 so that the other two could split push and take an inhibitor. If I had not been Lucian and built to hyper carry we probably would have lost that game.
I lost to beginner bots a game where I had THREE intentional feeders. Sad times.
I have some losses from the time when I started playing, no big deal
i have like 16 losses lol, its funny to surrender to the bots
i remember a time when i lost a bot game.... im pretty sure that everyone on my team dced and the minions ended it without anyone actually playing.....

I lost a bot game once, my team was just so bad and uncoordinated that they couldn't do anything and I couldn't 1v5 as a support champion. It was a strange experience to see the score at 3-30 and have the slow dawning realization that we might just lose a bot game.

I remember losing one of my first few intermediate bot games because i ran this build on sona. 

{{champion:37}} {{item:3003}} {{item:3006}} {{item:3006}} {{item:3085}} {{item:3174}} {{item:3174}} 

2 of our top laners quit, and our mid laner flamed me all game from the fountain.
i swear to god, i thought this build was BROKEN AND OP.

#NoobLOLProblems

I remember I was some 10 IP short of getting a champion or something ridiculous like that. So, not wanting to waste my time, I played a Co-op vs. AI match.

So, I was matched with some other level 30's and this god-forsaken Ashe was so terrible...she died literally 22 times - to beginner bots.
At the end of the match (we had won, o/c), I said "nice job, ashe" because she had gotten a quadra kill right before we killed the enemy nexus.

I guess she took it sarcastically, because I was notified that my "toxic behavior" had resulted in a 5-minute low-priority queue time penalty for 5 future matches.
Seriously? A beginner bot Co-op vs AI game, and I was reported and given a time penalty for something so ridiculously small - something that wasn't even meant to be toxic.

Needless to say, I played 5 more Co-Op vs AI games just to get the stupid time penalty gone.
I remember thinking the bots were unbeatable and unfair. Then I watched some streams and such and got better, realised how fucking stupid I was.

when i first started in s3 ahri had just come out and i would see all these ahris go godlike and im playing kogmaw fucking diving turrets getting killed by minons and shit, back then i thought ahri and pantheon were op af. my first kill ever was with annie lol
I am guilty of this, but not beginner tho --- so there's that. I don't like getting wrecked and flamed because I'm so bad at this game ._.
